title: Students loan re-financier SoFi successfully raises $1 bn
text:
Students loan re-financier SoFi successfully raises $1 bn 
Technology Industry News.Net : Thursday 1st October, 2015 
NEW YORK / TOKYO US financial technology startup SoFi, a leading marketplace lender, has received $1 billion funding led by Japan's SoftBank Group, marking the largest single financing round in the fintech space to date, the companies said in a joint statement Wednesday. 
Existing investors participating in the Series E funding round led by SoftBank include Third Point Ventures and affiliates of Third Point LLC, Wellington Management Company LLP, Institutional Venture Partners (IVP), RenRen, Baseline Ventures, DCM Ventures and others. 
The funding is expected to help accelerate SoFi's growth as the primary financial services partner for high achieving consumers seeking an alternative to the traditional banking. 
The Series E round brings total equity investment in SoFi to $1.42 billion. 
The firm, which started in 2011 by offering graduates to consolidate and refinance their federal and private student loans, has been profitable since 2014. San Francisco headquartered SoFi has over $4 billion issued in student loan financing. 
The latest infusion of capital closely follows SoFi's Series D round in February this year. 
"SoFi continues to redefine consumer expectations in financial services," said Mike Cagney, SoFi CEO and co-founder. 
"This funding will dramatically advance expansion of our disruptive products and experiences, and in turn, meaningfully benefit financially responsible individuals. Our trajectory is clear: we are well on our way to becoming the most trusted financial services partner in the US," he added. 
In the last four years, the SoFi has expanded its offerings to include mortgages, mortgage refinancing, and personal loans, while earning industry-leading customer loyalty. The firm has funded more than $4 billion in loans to date and is expected to surpass $6 billion in funded loans by the end of 2015. 
For SoftBank, this investment further strengthen its links with tech startups, which includes Alibaba Group Holding Ltd and Yahoo Japan 
"SoftBank seeks to invest in large industries or geographies that are ripe for change," said Nikesh Arora, President and COO of SoftBank Group Corp. 
"This investment gives SoftBank exposure to the financial services sector, which is one of the largest and most important industries in the world. SoFi is clearly a game changer in the fintech space," he added. 
The Series E funding is expected to fuel SoFi's growth in product innovation, delivery, community value and team building as it expands its offerings to deepen member relationships and continue investing in its proprietary model for underwriting credit risk. 
The US startup has been working to simplify the user experience and deliver even more of its services online, particularly through mobile devices. 
The company is in the process of expanding its member services, including its Entrepreneur Program and Career Services team. 
The company currently has more than 400 full-time employees and expects to add at least 100 more by year-end. 
To house its burgeoning sales, servicing and underwriting teams, SoFi is doubling its office space in Healdsburg, California to 20,000 sq feet while expanding its 50-strong engineering office in Helena, Montana, along with its offices in Washington, DC and Frisco, Texas.
